a6e521ea-6b46-4811-9974-b7796e93081e.subject: Ice Breaker activities
a6e521ea-6b46-4811-9974-b7796e93081e.body:
Hi folks!
Hi everyone

NB. Please read the module as these activities and instructions are in the introductory part of the module.

Use this Forum to introduce yourself and share with the others who are participating in the "Getting to know you" Ice Breaker activity.

First, after reading the instructions, go back one page by clicking on the links at the top. [You need to click on the Forum title to go back – “Introduce yourself here”.]

Forums->Introduce yourself here->1- How to Introduce yourself here

Then click on "New Topic" link above to open a new space for your own introduction.

Use your own name as the "subject" and then write a short introduction to yourself.

Tell us a little about yourself,

How you define yourself,

Tell us something about your language, any other languages you know and the languages that you often hear around you.

If you want to add a photo, you can also upload a file, by adding an attachment.

If you want to reply to someone else's introduction, you can click on "Reply" below their message.

 

You can read a few of our examples to get the idea. Good luck!

Your TA (Anita Mpofu)

Hi folks
Kindly follow instructions of Ice Breaker 3 in the initial unit of the module. Click on Self assessment tool and complete the Survey. Make sure you do all the Ice breaker activities. NB. Read the learning units, don't just attempt activities without reading the learning units.

Some of you are doing very well. Keep it up! I will send you more information about assignment 1 as soon as possible.

A. Mpofu (TA)

25019b37-f2c2-4631-ada2-ff0086d4ac4d.subject: Very Impontant! Posting Assignment 1 and extension date.
25019b37-f2c2-4631-ada2-ff0086d4ac4d.body:
Dear Students

Kindly go back to Discussions and if you created your own topic copy thre assignment and paste it as"Reply"to the topic of your TA A MPOFU. Otherwise your assignment will not be connected to the Grade book and it might not be properly Marked.

We now have up to Monday 11/02 to complete our assignment.

Good luck.
Assignment 1: Language Diversity
After reading the article about the Greaves' family, discuss the important elements about language diversity that you discovered in the article.

You can think about these questions to get you started:
  • How will a family who adopts a child from another language cope?
  • How should they deal with the issue of multiple languages in the same family?
  • Is this a good thing? Why or why not?

Click "Reply" on this topic to add your contribution.

When you have finished, you should also read the discussions of your fellow students and reply to their discussions, if you agree or disagree. Remember, in academic situations -- even online -- we strive to be polite and helpful at all times.Go back to the "Rules of Engagement" for more about Netiquette and online behaviour.

A Mpofu

1dcb9569-f815-4034-a0bf-06d903ce5a29.subject: Assignment 1
1dcb9569-f815-4034-a0bf-06d903ce5a29.body: Read the instructions ad make a quality discussion following given information: Go to discussions tool and click the forum assignment. Click new topic to create a new topic for your name and upload your assignment in the message box. NB. The details of the assignment After reading the article about the Greaves' family, discuss the important elements about language diversity that you discovered in the article. You can think about these questions to get you started: How will a family who adopts a child from another language cope? How should they deal with the issue of multiple languages in the same family? Is this a good thing? Why or why not? Remember to start your Discussions with a good title. When you have finished, you should also read the discussions of your fellow students and reply to their discussions, if you agree or disagree. Remember, in academic situations -- even online -- we strive to be polite and helpful at all times.Go back to the "Rules of Engagement" for more about Netiquette and online behaviour. A. Mpofu (TA)
